models.description: A simple IFC model representing a wall structure with two windows.

models.description: An IFC model representing a domestic hot water system with various components.

tasks.description: Provide a very brief high-level summary of the model's content and purpose.
tasks.expected_result: Content: This model represents a domestic hot water system, including pipes, a water heater tank, a sink, a bathtub, faucets, and a floor. Purpose: Testing IFC, software development and education.

tasks.description: How many pipe segments are present in the model?
tasks.expected_result: 9 (10 if you count the pipe fitting as a segment)

tasks.description: What is the length, width, and thickness of the floor.
tasks.expected_result: Length: 10 m, Width: 4.1 m, Thickness: 0.15 m

tasks.description: How many sinks are present in the model?
How many bathtubs are present in the model?
How far above the floor is the top of the sink?
How many water heater tanks are present in the model?
What pipe segments are used to connect the water heater tank to the sink?
tasks.expected_result: PIP_20 or #1403, PIP_20_001 or #1865, PIP_20_002 or #1770, PIP_20_003 or #1705, PIP_20_005 or #1455, PIP_20_007 or #1529 (TEE_20 or #2059 if you count the pipe fitting as a segment)

tasks.description: What pipe segments are used to connect the water heater tank to the bathtub?
tasks.expected_result: PIP_20 or #1403, PIP_20_004 or #2132, PIP_20_005 or #1455, PIP_20_006 or #1621, PIP_20_007 or #1529 (TEE_20 or #2059 if you count the pipe fitting as a segment)

tasks.description: Is the model satisfactory for a bathroom?
tasks.expected_result: No, the model lacks a toilet, which is essential for a bathroom.
